intro: Hexasepalum angustatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hexasepalum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers with six sepals. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and they bloom during the wet season. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
